revised_title: Tectonic Stress in the Lithosphere: Inferences of Deviatoric Stress in Actively Deforming Belts
tldr: This article examines the deviatoric stress in the deeper parts of the lithosphere by comparing theoretical models with observations of heat flux, temperature, strain rate, and topography in zones of active continental deformation. The authors estimate that shear stress in the upper portions of major active thrust faults is several tens to hundreds of MPa, contributing to the support of mountain ranges. The study also provides insights into the stress distribution associated with active and inactive thrust faults.
